title.narrative: SOCIAL POLICY

description.narrative: National institutions and local authorities have strengthened capacity to develop and implement evidence-based, adequately funded and equity-focused policies and programmes addressing child poverty and social exclusion, which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change, Reducing Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, boys and girls, especially most disadvantaged, benefit from effective national and local policies that support nurturing family and social environment to attain high standard of development, health, learning and well-being

mailing-address.narrative: 87 A. Doundukov Blvd. Fl.2 Sofia 1504 Bulgaria P.O. Box 801

sector.narrative: Child poverty analysis towards policy change (Profiling, mapping and identifying drivers of multi-dimensional and monetary poverty of children, modelling and simulation of policy options)
Children, adolescent and youth engagement and participation

Contributing to policies reducing child poverty: Poverty reduction strategies, national development plans, engagement with ministries, parliament, international donor and financial organizations, civil society organizations)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: National institutions and local authorities have strengthened capacity to develop and implement evidence-based, adequately fundedand equity-focused policies and programmes addressing child poverty and social exclusion

description.narrative: The main Social Policy intervention was the pilot testing of the Child Guarantee in Bulgaria, adopted by the EU as a key instrument for addressing child poverty and social exclusion. Through pilot project, which covers 10 pilot municipalities in 3 districts, UNICEF reached over 10,000 children, 3,500 parents and 500 professionals. A deep dive analysis of the national child poverty reduction policies was conducted and informed the National Action Plan for the Child Guarantee. The Situation Analysis on PFM and Children was finalized, and a Cost of Inaction tool for ECD programmes was tested. | Status:Met | As-of Date:06/01/2022

baseline.value: Lack of analysis of child poverty reduction policies in Bulgaria and other EU countries to inform the development of the National Strategy for Poverty Reduction 2030

target.value: 2022:National Strategy for Poverty Reduction and Promoting Social Inclusion 2030 incorporating measures for child poverty reduction adopted
